column4: http://pastebin.com/4k5nvtUR <-- anybody can help me with this? (package system broken)
Just off the top of my head.  sudo aptitude install -f
That command attempts to fix all broken packages.  Be sure to read what it wants to do and think about it before hitting yes blindly! :)
any Other guess from the top of your head? is it my package system broken forever?
Where did this package come from?  A special repo or something?
I think that package is written poorly.  I'm not sure how to remove it though :(  What command did you run to install it in the first place?  dpkg?  Did you download a .deb ??
i tried dpkg -i package.deb ... then unmet dependencies, so i run apt-get install -f... then this nightmare began :(
Can you sudo apt-get purge package    ??
I don't think you'll have to re-install.
Ask the channel in a different manner.  "Why can't I remove a package from my system?"
